title: How an NWS apprenticeship can offer skills for life and how apprentices are shaping the future of nuclear
authors: Adrienne Kelbie, Independent Chair of Nuclear Waste Services

content.text: Adrienne Kelbie, Independent Chair of Nuclear Waste Services (NWS), had what many would consider an unconventional start in the world of nuclear. Working as an administrative temp, she worked her way through varied roles that taught her career skills like financial and project management, governance and operational delivery, arriving as Chief Executive Officer for the Office of Nuclear Regulation in 2016.
Apprentices can fill the nuclear skills gap.
…and be a part of something bigger.
So, here’s why you should join the nuclear sector
